question: The mass of the elements iron and oxygen in four samples of a rustcolored substance was measured in grams (g). The amount of iron and oxygen in each sample is shown on the graph. <image 1>, Determine if the following content is correct based on the image and text:All four samples are the same compound.
description:
The image shows a graph titled "Mass of Elements in Samples." The x-axis represents the mass of oxygen in grams (g), ranging from 0 to 8 g. The y-axis represents the mass of iron in grams (g), ranging from 0 to 20 g. There are four data points plotted on the graph, each representing a different sample of a rust-colored substance. The data points are connected by a straight line, indicating a linear relationship between the mass of iron and the mass of oxygen in the samples.

Additionally, there is a mathematical expression provided below the graph:

\[
\frac{\text{g iron}}{\text{g oxygen}} = \frac{5 \text{ g iron}}{2.25 \text{ g oxygen}} \approx \frac{2.3 \text{ g iron}}{\text{g oxygen}}
\]

This expression suggests a ratio between the mass of iron and the mass of oxygen in the samples.
